queries.query: How to control powdery mildew in wheat?
queries.solution: Powdery mildew can be controlled by: 1) Using sulfur dust or wettable powder at 2.5% concentration, 2) Applying fungicides like Karathane at 0.075% concentration, 3) Ensuring proper spacing between plants for better air circulation, 4) Avoiding overhead irrigation, 5) Growing resistant varieties when available.

queries.query: What is the best time to plant rice?
queries.solution: Rice is typically planted during the monsoon season (June to August) in most parts of India. The ideal soil temperature should be 20-30°C. For transplanting, seedlings aged 30-40 days are best. In southern regions, two crops can be grown annually - summer rice and winter rice. Consult local agricultural department for region-specific timing.

queries.query: How much water does cotton require?
queries.solution: Cotton requires 40-50 irrigations during the growing season depending on rainfall and soil type. Total water requirement is 750-1000 mm. Critical irrigation stages are: flowering and boll formation. Use drip irrigation to save 30-40% water. Monitor soil moisture and avoid waterlogging. In rainfed areas, mulching helps retain moisture.

queries.query: What fertilizer should I use for sugarcane?
queries.solution: Sugarcane requires balanced nutrition: Nitrogen (N): 150-200 kg/ha, Phosphorus (P): 50-75 kg/ha, Potassium (K): 50-100 kg/ha. Use split applications of nitrogen in 3-4 doses. Add FYM 20-25 tons/ha before planting. Use vinasse or press mud as organic amendment. Foliar spray of micronutrients (Zn, B) improves yield. Consult soil test report for region-specific recommendations.

queries.query: How to identify and treat bacterial leaf spot in tomato?
queries.solution: Bacterial leaf spot appears as water-soaked lesions with yellow halo on tomato leaves. Control measures: 1) Use disease-free seeds, 2) Remove infected plants, 3) Spray copper fungicide (1%) or Bordeaux mixture (1%) every 10-14 days, 4) Avoid overhead irrigation, 5) Maintain proper plant spacing, 6) Sanitize tools and equipment.

queries.query: What is the best variety of onion for high yield?
queries.solution: High-yielding onion varieties include: Bhima Red (red), Bhima Shakti (red), Bhima Super (red), Nasik Red (red), and Punjab 48 (white). Yield potential ranges from 25-35 tons/ha. Choose varieties based on your region, market demand, and storage capacity. For long storage, red varieties are preferred. Consult local agricultural office for region-approved varieties.

queries.query: How to manage crop residue after harvest?
queries.solution: Crop residue management options: 1) In-situ incorporation using minimum tillage, 2) Composting for 2-3 months to add organic matter, 3) Use as animal fodder, 4) Biochar production for soil amendment, 5) Biogas production for energy. Benefits include improved soil health, carbon sequestration, and reduced burning. Choose method based on availability and end-use.

Harvest maize when: 1) Grain moisture content reaches 20-25%, 2) Kernels become hard and shiny, 3) 30-40 days after silking. Test moisture by pressing kernel with thumbnail - if thumbnail enters but doesn't puncture, it's ready. Timely harvest prevents grain loss and ensures better quality. Allow 1-2 days for field drying before mechanical harvesting.

queries.query: What is drip irrigation and its benefits?
queries.solution: Drip irrigation delivers water directly to plant roots through emitters. Benefits: Saves 30-60% water compared to flood irrigation, reduces weed growth by 50%, minimizes fertilizer runoff, improves crop yield by 20-30%, suitable for various crops and terrains. Cost: ₹40,000-60,000 per hectare for installation. Government subsidy available in many states (30-50% of cost). ROI achieved in 2-3 years.

queries.query: How to control armyworm in maize?
queries.solution: Armyworm control: 1) Monitor fields during early growth stages, 2) Spray Bacillus thuringiensis (Bt) bio-insecticide, 3) Use chemical insecticides: Chlorpyrifos 1% or Carbaryl 0.2%, 4) Manual collection and destruction of egg masses, 5) Use pheromone traps for monitoring, 6) Encourage natural predators like parasitic wasps. Spray early morning or late evening for better efficacy.
